Subject: Re: Forms and Features - MAXIMALS!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=167039986; y=UfUoQV7pFt04sO4-8lOnDPXQW9uBP1E6BjgN1tNHCYY-pCOTDKs

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

With a gentile smile, Tucson returns the kiss and holds his wing over them =
to provide a moment alone with Talon.  After the kiss he lowers his wing an=
d notices that a collection of small creatures surrounding him and Talon . =
 Yet they do so in a fashion of admiration rather than hostility.  Tucson l=
ooks to them curiously.

" I'm not sure why these creatures are curious abo=
ut us but it appears as if they're here to admire rather than attack.  I wo=
nder...  "

He stands up and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once =
more.  The creatures draw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon.  It w=
as clear that the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures,=
 but that was about to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron.  It was=
 a massive guilt slammed upon his heart.  Yet how could he get the animals =
to understand that he had to leave them in such a short time?  He was now t=
heir guardian and they were looking up to him for protection.  

" Talon, t=
hese creatures remember the old dragon that sought to their protection and =
realize that I have taken his place.  It's as I thought, they aren't aware =
of who we really are, and where we are from.  They will not understand that=
 we must leave them shortly, for good, and Primus knows what will happen to=
 them once we leave. ...  Talon, I hear something coming. It's not a Predac=
on but it's a fairly large creature."

Not far from them, Tucson spots the =
scales of a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream =
next to them.  He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lift=
s its head.  It was another dragon.  Yet this one was a bit smaller than he=
 was, but the same coloration.  He takes note of its slender shape.  It was=
 female.  She looks to him as he looks to her.  She slowly approaches him a=
nd they look gently to each other like brother and sister.  In draconic voc=
alization, Tucson explains who he is and his dilemma.  She intern rumbles b=
ack and bows her head.  She nods as he does.  It was their way of communica=
ting as Tucson looks back to Talon.

" Apparently the old dragon has family=
 here.  They are scattered but they exist.  And she said that she will prot=
ect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as long as th=
ey live.  And she wishes us good luck on our journey."

With that, the drag=
oness leaves them peacefully to enjoy their time together.  With a gentile =
groan, the creatures too, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both =
of them.

Local artist who specializes in illustration, using traditional a=
nd digital media.  

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any =
occasion!  

Need a great gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email m=
e at this address and we will talk.

> Talon
>

> 
> --- In nbwrpg@ya=
hoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> >
> > Tucson holds =
Talon gently with an arm around her shoulders. He looks up and then back to=
 her.
> > 
> > " Like a branch on a tree that has broken off during a storm=
 and regrows in a different direction than it had been, before it had broke=
n off. I know exactly how you feel. I feel the same way. At one time, I was=
 blind, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I=
 fought along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at following orders. =
I was well grounded but lost at the same time. Then, I met you and things b=
egan to change on a more positive note. You may not believe this, but you h=
elped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to=
 my true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more w=
heels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different. But one thing d=
idn't change, I was still battling blindness off and on. Then, a third chan=
ge, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which could not be repaire=
d, I was guided to my final evolution, this one. All of these things wouldn=
't have come about if I had never met you. And I wouldn't have it any other=
 way. Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are, and hopefully we c=
an tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondrous varieties of =
life that live here."
> > 
> > The rodent climbs down and drops a nut into =
his hand, and chatters to him.
> > 
> > " This is for us to keep? Thank you=
, we will take good care of it."
> > 
> > He places the nut in Talon's hand=
.
> > 
> > " I think we have a way to bring back a small reminder of this p=
lanet. Let's see if we can encourage it to grow on ours."

> > > > > > With a happy look =
on his face, Tucson walks with Talon, down the corridor and out to a walkin=
g trail which he had been down before but could not see. It was leading to =
the old dragon's cave. But the path itself carries a serene atmosphere as a=
 gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks while dragonflies dodge=
 the current of the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson could actual=
ly enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > " I=
've been this way once before, but I wanted to return here when it was poss=
ible for both of us to enjoy it together. And now, we can. I can see why Le=
o is concerned, so much innocent life, too valuable to destroy. The entire =
planet is a treasure within itself. And who better to enjoy this treasure t=
han with you? No one. I only hope that after we leave, this world will rema=
in as pure as it is now. But there's more that I want to show you."
> > > >=
 > > 
> > > > > > He takes Talon into a forest of giant trees and points up=
ward.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > " If you sit under this tree and look straig=
ht up, it appears to be reaching to the sky, yet it shades you from the hea=
t of the sun. It provides shelter and protection, yet it does so in an inno=
cent manner. It's something Master Yoketron taught me, when he was my Sensa=
i. See things with a different perspective and not always what everyone els=
e sees. Here, I'll show you. "
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He shows Talon to a=
 boulder beneath a large hardwood tree and sits right under it,looking up.
=
> > > > > >

'll see what I mean."

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>With a gentile smile, Tuc=
son returns the kiss and holds his wing over them to provide a moment alone=
 with Talon.  After the kiss he lowers his wing and notices that a col=
lection of small creatures surrounding him and Talon .  Yet they do so=
 in a fashion of admiration rather than hostility.  Tucson looks to th=
em curiously.</div><div><br></div><div>" I'm not sure why these creatures a=
re curious about us but it appears as if they're here to admire rather than=
 attack.  I wonder...  "</div><div><br></div><div>He stands up an=
d gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more.  The creatures d=
raw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon.  It was clear that the=
 Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but that was abo=
ut to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron.  It was a massive g=
uilt slammed upon his heart.  Yet how could he get the animals to unde=
rstand that he had to leave them in such a short time?  He was now the=
ir guardian and they were looking up to him for protection.  </div><di=
v><br></div><div>" Talon, these creatures remember the old dragon that soug=
ht to their protection and realize that I have taken his place.  It's =
as I thought, they aren't aware of who we really are, and where we are from=
.  They will not understand that we must leave them shortly, for good,=
 and Primus knows what will happen to them once we leave. ...  Talon, =
I hear something coming. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large creatu=
re."</div><div><br></div><div>Not far from them, Tucson spots the scales of=
 a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream next to t=
hem.  He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts it=
s head.  It was another dragon.  Yet this one was a bit smaller t=
han he was, but the same coloration.  He takes note of its slender sha=
pe.  It was female.  She looks to him as he looks to her.  S=
he slowly approaches him and they look gently to each other like brother an=
d sister.  In draconic vocalization, Tucson explains who he is and his=
 dilemma.  She intern rumbles back and bows her head.  She nods a=
s he does.  It was their way of communicating as Tucson looks back to =
Talon.</div><div><br></div><div>" Apparently the old dragon has family here=
.  They are scattered but they exist.  And she said that she will=
 protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as long =
as they live.  And she wishes us good luck on our journey."</div><div>=
<br></div><div>With that, the dragoness leaves them peacefully to enjoy the=
ir time together.  With a gentile groan, the creatures too, depart. It=
 was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.</div><div><br>Local artist =
who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media. &nbsp=
;<div><br></div><div>I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for=
 any occasion!  </div><div><br></div><div>Need a great gift idea that =
is original?  No problem!  Email me at this address and we will t=
alk.  </div></div><div><br>On Jun 19, 2012, at 4:00 AM, "C" <<a hre=
f=3D"mailto:airly2002@...">airly2002@...</a>> wrote:<br>=
<br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

yle=3D"display:none"> </span>

<br>

e nut and with out word she kissed him.<br>

><br>
> Tucson holds Talon gently with an =
arm around her shoulders.  He looks up and then back to her.<br>
> <br>
=
> " Like a branch on a tree that has broken off during a storm and regro=
ws in a different direction than it had been, before it had broken off.  I =
know exactly how you feel.  I feel the same way.   At one time, I was blind=
, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel.  I foug=
ht along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at following orders.  I wa=
s well grounded but lost at the same time.  Then, I met you and things bega=
n to change on a more positive note.  You may not believe this, but you hel=
ped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to m=
y true fate.  Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more wh=
eels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different.  But one thing d=
idn't change, I was still battling blindness off and on.  Then, a third cha=
nge, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which could not be repair=
ed, I was guided to my final evolution, this one.  All of these things woul=
dn't have come about if I had never met you.  And I wouldn't have it any ot=
her way.  Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are, and hopefully =
we can tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondrous varieties=
 of life that live here."<br>
> <br>
> The rodent climbs down and dro=
ps a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.<br>
> <br>
> " This is f=
or us to keep?  Thank you, we will take good care of it."<br>
> <br>
&gt=
; He places the nut in Talon's hand.<br>
> <br>
> " I think we have a=
 way to bring back a small reminder of this planet.  Let's see if we can en=
courage it to grow on ours."<br>

erene atmosphere as a gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks wh=
ile dragonflies dodge the current of the water. And now, for the first time=
, Tucson could actually enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. <br>
&gt=
; > > > > <br>
> > > > > " I've been this way on=
ce before, but I wanted to return here when it was possible for both of us =
to enjoy it together. And now, we can. I can see why Leo is concerned, so m=
uch innocent life, too valuable to destroy. The entire planet is a treasure=
 within itself. And who better to enjoy this treasure than with you? No one=
. I only hope that after we leave, this world will remain as pure as it is =
now. But there's more that I want to show you."<br>

 Master Yoketron taught me, when he was my Sensai. See things with a differ=
ent perspective and not always what everyone else sees. Here, I'll show you=
. "<br>
